message.content:
Climate change has implications for freshwater resources, food security, coastal communities and infrastructure, human health, energy production and distribution. It intensifies the frequency and severity of extreme weather events - such as hurricanes, heatwaves, floods and droughts.

Some specific impacts are:

1. Rising sea levels: As glaciers in polar regions melt due to increasing land temperatures or rising oceanic heat content cause thermal expansion of water (as it warms), global sea levels rise. This threatens habitats for marine life as well as folks living on coastlines worldwide which could lead to flooding or coastal erosion that eventually forces people out of their homes.
